issues.title: Flaky daemonize test
issues.body:
test_daemon.py is failing sporadically on my linux desktop:

```

    def test_daemonize(self):
        if not HAS_DAEMONIZE:
            raise Skip("need `daemonize` for this test case")

        def daemon_helper():
            time.sleep(100)
            self.fail()

        with NamedTemporaryFile() as tf:
            # Fork so daemonizing the current process does not mess up with the
            # test suite.

            if child_pid == 0:
                try:
                    daemon.daemonize(daemon_helper, name='sparts_unittest',

                timer.run_until_true(checkdaemon, timeout=1.0)
```

issues.title: test_tornado's test_execute_async flaky
issues.body:
It seems this test may be flaky given that it succeeded on all other python flavors.
https://travis-ci.org/facebook/sparts/jobs/119671018

```
tests/tasks/test_settaskoption.py ..
tests/tasks/test_tornado.py .
=================================== FAILURES ===================================
________________________ TestMyTask.test_execute_async _________________________
self = <tests.tasks.test_periodic.TestMyTask testMethod=test_execute_async>
    def test_execute_async(self):
        f = self.task.execute_async()
        res = f.result(3.0)
        self.assertNotNone(res)
        self.assertGreater(res, 0)

        # Verify exception path
        self.task.fail_async = True
        with self.assertRaises(Exception) as ctx:
            # Call this twice, since there's a race condition where setting
            # fail_async and getting the future from execute_async is called
            # when execute is between the self.fail_async check and the return
            self.task.execute_async().result(1.0)
>           self.task.execute_async().result(1.0)
E           AssertionError: Exception not raised
tests/tasks/test_periodic.py:60: AssertionError
```

issues.title: Support persistence in PollerTask
issues.body:
Add a flag that will enable writing fetched values to disk, restore on startup.

add a validate hook to verify the contents in case the format changed.

issues.title: gflags support
issues.body:
It's common to use py wrapped cpp libraries that use gflags.

Build a bridge to expose any gflags defined in this way theough argparse, and preferably the options interfaces as well

issues.title: Support for triggering in-thread execution of `PeriodicTask`
issues.body: Maybe called `trigger()`?

issues.title: Switch from `six` to `python-future`
issues.body: `six` is nice, but `python-future` provides more compatibility (e.g., backports), useful for obsoleting some other modules/dependencies like ordereddict, and futures

issues.title: -W (--warnings) option with default to error
issues.body:
Support a flag like python's -W

Default should be -Werror instead of -Wdefault

issues.title: Thrift usage statistics
issues.body:
fbthrift's python implementation provides `TProcessorEventHandler` hooks; this allows us to monitor thrift server method usage and errors, and potentially even call duration.

Let's figure out how to get this functionality for sparts, either by switching to fbthrift, conditionally using the API (if present), or emulating it with some kind of dynamic TProcessor subclass or wrapper.

issues.title: thrift libraries incompatible with py3k
issues.body:
Currently, sparts' thrift support depends on [apache thrift](https://github.com/apache/thrift), which (to my knowledge) does not generate py3k compatible code.

[fbthrift](github.com/facebook/fbthrift)'s compiler is capable of generating py3k compatible code, but (a) its different command line arguments are incompatible with `sparts.thrift.compiler` and (b) the fbthrift Python bindings are not appropriately packaged (e.g., on pypi)

issues.title: Unittest logspew in tests/tasks/test_tornado.py with python-3.4
issues.body:
Since effectively enabling -Wall in unit test runs, the following logs appear when running: `py.test tests/tasks/test_tornado.py` with python-3.4.0.

```
Exception ignored in: <_io.FileIO name=11 mode='wb'>
ResourceWarning: unclosed file <_io.FileIO name=11 mode='wb'>
Exception ignored in: <_io.FileIO name=10 mode='rb'>
ResourceWarning: unclosed file <_io.FileIO name=10 mode='rb'>
```

This does not repro with python 3.3.5:

issues.title: Automatic man-page generator
issues.body: Provide some hooks to generate a man page file for the configured arguments and docstrings.

issues.title: Enable OSX travis support
issues.body: Might be tricky since we build the thrift compiler from source

issues.title: Rate limit helpers / hooks for QueueTask
Declarative, bindable events
issues.body: We use `threading.Event()`s in a couple of places in code.  Making these `_Bindable` class attributes will allow us to define them declaratively and enable them to be more easily exported.

issues.title: Published documentation
issues.body: As part of the build process, publish documentation.  Possibly to https://pythonhosted.org/ ?

issues.title: Auto-Reconnect support for ThriftClient
issues.body: If we're re-using the client and it gets timed out, let's reconnect automatically.

issues.title: Fb303++
issues.body:
fb303 only provides so much extra value.  A base sparts service can build on top of this:
- clearWarnings, getWarnings
- exportedValues
- getTaskTracebacks
- getMemTypeStats
- getCpuUsage
- remote/local debug hooks

issues.title: Make it easier / better to work with tornado web
issues.body:
Tornado's http object model is fairly verbose.  On top of that, it's not super easy to transparently integrate in a way that results in good monitoring / metrics

Do something about this.

issues.title: CronTask
issues.body: Like PeriodicTask, but supporting cron spec.  Maybe a parent class of Periodic?

issues.title: Thread safe counters
issues.body: Currently they're not really thread safe

issues.title: Infinite windows for samples
issues.body: Add ability for samples to export an "infinite" time window.

issues.title: Thrown TryLater should support a delay/backoff
issues.body:
Right now, TryLater's work or periodic and queue executions by re-running and/or re-inserting the work into the queue instantly.

Support setting an attribute on TryLater() that contains the time to wait in ms before trying again.

issues.title: inotify task
issues.body:
A common use case is watching a directory / tree for changes and acting on changes.

inotify (e.g., pyinotify) is the proper way of handling this.

Create a task for monitoring a filesystem path for changes.

issues.title: Configuration helpers
issues.body:
Support auto-configuration (e.g., of command line arguments' defaults) in a sensible and/or intuitive way.

That is, provide some API for a service to specify that it should have its configuration auto-loaded from some well-defined set of locations.  This should use well-known native or opensource APIs.

The configuration should be in a format that is intuitive to read/set-up but should also be comprehensive.  Ultimately, it should translate to specifying defaults for command line arguments (e.g., sparts "options").

When running with -h, the %(default)s in the helptext should reflect the results of found configuration files.  Additionally there should be some log message or stderr output that indicates what configuration file is being used during startup.

issues.title: scribe integration?
issues.body: Support logging messages directly to scribe.

issues.title: Documentation
issues.body: generate proper pydocs for everything.

issues.title: Log Tailer task
issues.body: Task for tailing log files in real-time

issues.title: Isolated / subprocess workers
issues.body:
By default, workers run in child threads.  Provide hooks to allow child tasks to run in a child process, "isolated" from other processes / tasks.

Handle this gracefully in queue tasks.

issues.title: Add runit --install/--uninstall to VService options
issues.body:
Add an --install option that creates the necessary directories to bootstrap the service into runit.

--uninstall removes the directories

commit.message:
Merge pull request #110 from tiagmoraismorgado/patch-1

fixing minor spelling typos
fixing minor spelling typos

Merge pull request #108 from djipko/master

QueuTask: prevent unhandled exception from tearing the main loop down

QueuTask: prevent unhandled exception from tearing the main loop down

Prior to this patch - raising an exception inside an execute() of a
queued
task when using futures instead of deferreds, would tear down the whole
service thread. This is almost certainly not what we want.

The cleanest way to fix this seems to be in the ExecutionContext, where
we consider an exception handled if it's set on a future, and let the
submitter worry about it.

Attempt to fix race in SelectTask

Let's mark the future as running as soon as we create it.  By the time
ProcessStreamHandler() is instantiated, the caller has passed us an
already running Popen, so it doesn't make much sense to create the
adapter before setting this.

This should fix #106 and #99
Officially add 3.5 support
Remove python 3.2 support

Merge pull request #104 from chantra/fix_nargs

[option] handle nargs properly

[travis] Force running in containers, not VM

* Add support for IPv6 loopback
* speed up test spin up

[tests] Fix test_daemon to not abort the rest of the test suite

If we do not fork within the test where we daemonize, the current
process will get daemonize and the test suite will stop.

Enforce Twisted<15.5.0 for python 2.6

15.5.0 is the last release supporting python 2.6 [0]... but actually
doesn't support it [1].
Let's make it <15.5.0
[0] https://twistedmatrix.com/trac/browser/tags/releases/twisted-15.5.0/NEWS?format=raw
[1] https://twistedmatrix.com/trac/browser/tags/releases/twisted-15.5.0/twisted/__init__.py#L16

[option] handle nargs properly

Fixes #103

More thrift.compiler tweaks

- whitespace fix
- use six.iteritems instead of .iteritems() method
- explicitly pass mode='w' when writing to NamedTemporaryFile for importThriftStr

Make compiler.{get|require}_executable public

Some internal functions in thrift.compiler are reusable in unit tests.
Explicitly expose them and use them.
Version bump to 0.7.3
Correctly skip test_multiplexed when thrift bindings not present

Fix bug in file unittest exposed by mock changes

Previously, Mock was returning a mock object on accesses to all
undefined attributes, so when calling `assert_called`, we'd get
back a mock object which is implicitly True.

Newer versions of mock seem to correctly raise an AttributeError,
so we need to use the correct function.
Include TMultiplexedServer, CppServer CHANGES
Add a test case to verify Multiplexed server/client functionality

[thrift] Add more useful error for multiple processors when MULTIPLEX=False

Suggest setting MULTIPLEX = True on your server

TMultiplexed{Service|Protocol} Proof of Concept

Fixes #102
Some comment updates in ThriftServerTask
Initial version of TCppServer-based ThriftServerTask
Prefer thrift1 (fbthrift) compiler when available
Refactor sparts/tasks/thrift.py into submodules
Updated CHANGES.txt for recent changes

ThriftClient should throw during constructor on invalid module

When the compiled thrift module is passed instead of the service module,
throw in the constructor with a helpful error message.
Fix sparts.thrift.compiler convenience compile method

Merge pull request #101 from bboozzoo/bboozzoo/sdist-license

manifest: add manifest

manifest: add manifest

Adding MANIFEST so that both LICENSE and PATENTS will be picked up for
source dist. Although not required this is generally useful when
packaging for Linux distributions.

Signed-off-by: Maciek Borzecki <maciek.borzecki@gmail.com>

Set Twisted maxversion <15.2 for py3.2

Even though Twisted doesn't seem to officially support python3.2,
Twisted-15.2 explicitly breaks the parts of Twisted that we're using
in sparts.

Set a max version for now, but we should consider disabling the Twisted
bits entirely for 3.2 in the long-term.

Handle missing directories in DirectoryWatcherTask more gracefully

Instead of crashing on ENOENT, catch it and log a warning.

A new test case verified we no longer break.

Fixes #56
Add test case for #56

Update tests/tasks/test_file.py to use NamedTemporaryDirectory

...instead of mkdtemp directly.

Tests still pass.

Added readfilebytes and writefilebytes

These methods are like readfile and writefile, but don't treat the
output/input as unicode respectively.

Play more nicely with test frameworks that hijack sys.stdout

Some test frameworks replace sys.stdout with a StringIO.  StringIO
doesn't have an `encoding` attribute.  In this case, fall back to
sys.getdefaultencoding()
Update patent grant: http://fb.me/patents2
More tweaks to setup.py to better support py3k
setup.py: ignore empty lines

Version bump to 0.7.2 for release

Also updated CHANGES (adding another note about dbus stability)

Merge pull request #98 from bboozzoo/bboozzoo/dbus-threading-fixes-for-upstream

dbus: multithreading fixes

dbus: init glib threading during DBusMainLoopTask init

Signed-off-by: Maciek Borzecki <maciek.borzecki@gmail.com>

dbus: move commented out bus.close() to asyncStopCb

Signed-off-by: Maciek Borzecki <maciek.borzecki@gmail.com>
dbus: more tests for DBusTask.asyncRun()
dbus: refactor asyncRun to return Future()
setup: whitespace cleanup

dbus: refactor tests to make passive checks

To avoid direct calls to dbus, make passive checks for class field
that is set only if the service failed to acquire the desired name.

dbus: pass service start() and stop() handling through the main loop

The main loop used by dbus connection is spinning in separate thread in
which the DBusMainLoopTask is running. DBus bindings are not
thread-safe, and the loop has already started (DBusMainLoopTask is a
prerequisite for DBusServiceTask). The only safe way to make dbus calls
is by passing them through the thead in which the loop is being run.

Note that in typical dbus applications most of dbus calls is done before
the main loop starts or the calls are performed within the callbacks in
the main loop. The only way to reproduce this is to use idle callback
that can be added in a thread-safe manner.

dbus: cleanup loop quitting

Releasing a reference to the main loop just after quit may give
unexpected results as the actual Glib g_main_loop_quit() does not wait
for the loop to finish. However, the loop may be safely cleaned up after
run() returns.

dbus: DBusTask.asyncRun() helper

Adding DBusTask.asyncRun() helper method for running a callback within
the context of thread running the main loop (an in fact within the main
loop). The method should be used to run any GLib-depending
non-thread-safe code, such as dbus calls.
dbus: init threading support before any other code
Updated CHANGES to include dbus system bus support

Merge pull request #97 from bboozzoo/bboozzoo/dbus-system-bus

Support for DBus system bus and a couple of test cases

dbus: skip FB303 in demo code if import failed

FB303 depends on Thrift. The demo code exits with ImportError if Thrift
is not available.
dbus: append random number to test service name
dbus: USE_SYSTEM_BUS class attribute
dbus: rename getBus to _makeBus
dbus: remove trailing whitespace in tests

dbus: skip dbus tests if dbus module cannot be imported

DBus support modules are usually provided by host system stack. Skip the
test if dbus cannot be imported.
dbus: minimal test case for dbus tasks

dbus: support for system bus

DBus task can automatically try to obtain a name on a system bus if
--dbus-system-bus is passed in command line. Optionally one can override
DBusTask.getBus() method to return the desired dbus.Bus object.

Updated six dependency to require >= 1.5.0

Fixes #96

Fix race condition in unittest

Fixes #95
Update CHANGES.txt

TryLater(..., after=seconds)

Add support for a new kwarg for TryLater, `after` seconds.  This will
enable you to, instead of retrying your work immediately, wait `after`
seconds before trying again.

Remove unnecessary property kwargs

Not sure why there are *args and **kwargs on this property.
Remove them.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master'

dbus: Disable FB303 autoregister if thrift isn't installed

Allow dbus integration (e.g., for signal handling) even if thrift isn't available.
Update compiler.py

PeriodicTask.execute_async()

Add a new method, execute_async() to PeriodicTask (and subclasses).
This method returns a future that completes or raises when the
corresponding task's execute() method completes or raises respectively.

Don't replace "_" with "-" in option internals

The replacement logic in callers, etc has been reworked since the
initial implementation.

I've added test cases for all known expected use-cases, so there
shouldn't be any surprises here.

Fixes #91
Add test cases to catch #91
Allow unittests to set custom command line args

setup.py: Fail upload command on uncommitted changes

Allow untracked files for now.  Fail on any uncommitted change.

Fixes #89

Updated to latest fmoo/thrift fork

This gets .gitignore changes to hide python build artifacts

Revbump to 0.7.1

Also rename 0.7.0 in CHANGES.txt to 0.7.1, since 0.7.0 is broken due to
a dirty checkout

VService.DEFAULT_LOGFILE, --logfile option logs to file instead of stdout

Provide some hooks to allow sparts to log to a file instead of stderr.
CHANGES.txt for recent bugfix

Use wait() instead of poll() during subprocess shutdown

There is a race condition between the output pipes being closed by the
child and python updating the returncode on the Popen object.  Let's use
wait() instead of poll() to avoid this and not get a called process
failure.

Should fix #88

sparts-0.7.0: Updated CHANGES.txt, version, etc

Let's do a new release with the specialized queue tasks and UI task.

sparts.tasks.tui.UITask

Barebones sparts wrapper to bootstrap an NPyScreenApp.  To use it, simply
override appStart to do something like:

  self.app.registerForm('main', self.make_form())
  self.app.setNextForm('main')

If the form exits, the service will shutdown gracefully.

Do hyphen substitution on entire option name

Currently, we only replace/replace hyphens in the option name (suffix).
Normalize the rest as (which can be set by OPT_PREFIX) as well.

Add a unittest to verify the functionality

Fixes #87

Comment/remove spammy debug messages

These were useful for testing, but aren't so much anymore.  Remove or
comment them out.

SelectTask.popen_communicate

Implement a couple of more wrapper objects for making working with
subprocesses easier.

The best way to go about this is with:

`SelectTask.popen_communicate(...)`

The args/kwargs to this function are identical to those of Popen.
stdout/stderr are implicitly set to PIPE.  A `Future` is returned and
a CommandResult object (with stdout, stderr attributes) returned on
success. FailedCommand is thrown on error (with a CommandResult instance
accessible via the .result attribute)

PeriodicTask: Improve error message when misused

First, init the stop_event before verifying the interval option.  This
way, if we crash during init, we don't also crash during shutdown
Secondly, add a message to the INTERVAL failure assert indicating that
INTERVAL must be specified or --{}-interval must be set.
Fix SelectTask unittest on py3k

SelectTask: Allow customizable decoder

Set the default from stdout.  This helps more of the unittests to pass
on py3k
SelectTask: configure a default logger
Updated CHANGES to include a note about Popen helpers
Fix SelectTask for py3
Add unittests for SelectTask, ProcessStreamHandler

sparts.tasks.select.ProcessStreamHandler

Implement `ProcessStreamHandler`, a helper class for interfacing Popen
objects with a SelectTask

SelectTask: Plug memory clean shutdown leak

Close the control pipes on runloop exit
SelectTask: some of these should be docstrings

SelectTask: test case, bugfixes

- rename "execute" to "except".
- bugfix: During the last refactor, forgot to send the control NEWFD on
newly registered/unregisted fds
- Add a test case.  Verifies read/write signals, but not except events
Updated CHANGES.txt for latest features

Explicit register/unregister select APIs per event mode

Instead of registering and unregistering an fd to every operation
(read, write, execute), require the caller to explicitly register
a callback for an fd and an operation.
Merge branch 'travis' into select

Fix clowny unittest failure.

Python 2.6's ContextManager __exit__ doesn't always return values
of `exc_value` properly when raising from C extensions.  Let's patch
around it in the test for now.
Use assertEqual in new unittest instead of assertEquals

DeprecationWarning in assertEquals for <py3k unittests

This will make it impossible to write unittests that spew/fail in py3+

SelectTask: Initial Prototype

Fixes #84

UniqueQueue should not dequeue work until after execute funishes

As-is, UniqueQueueTask doesn't play nicely with long-running execute
methods since queue.get() removes the object from the unique "seen" set
at dequeue time.  This diff refactors the Queue Task to do the
following:

- Enables `explicit_unsee` mode in UniqueQueueTask's UniqueQueue.
- Moves work completion handling scenarios (success, unhandled error,
and trylater) in QueueTask to separate functions, sharing a common `work_done`.
- Tracks whether the dequeued work was "raw" vs. already having an
ExecuteContext.
- Uses all of the above to appropriately "unsee" the work after execution,
even in the edge case where "TryLater" is thrown on "raw" dequeued work.

UniqueQueue: add an `explicit_unsee` attribute.

In addition to the `silent` mode, add an `explicit_unsee` mode to UniqueQueue.

By default, `explicit_unsee` is False, and tems are unseen as soon as
they are popped from the queue.

The problem is that for certain applications, we want to keep the item
as seen until `task_done()` is called.  Since task_done doesn't take an
argument, we add a new function, `unsee(item)` to facilitate this
behavior.

Add `map()` and `submit()` to QueueTask

This adds two new helper methods for interfacing with QueueTask,
`map()`, and `submit()`.

`submit()` inserts a piece of work into the QueueTask's queue, and
returns a future that will either return a result or raise when
the task's execute() function successfully completes (or fails) the work.

`map()` takes an array of work/items, and an optional `timeout`, and
returns the `result`s for all the futures generated by submitting them
as work.  The `timeout` is applied to the delay for each individual
piece of work.

Add a new `Callback` counter to `sparts.counters`

Callback counters take a positional argument, `callback`, which is
invoked every time getvalue() is called.

Workaround to better non-declarative counters

If a counter is instantiated non-declaratively (e.g., during initTask),
the options dictionary won't be configured in a way that can access it
by direct indexing.

We'll hack in a workaround for now:  If the object isn't directly
indexed in the counters dictionary, try to find the child with a name
specified by the first '.' partition, and get the counter from it.

This will work for counters that do not register child namespaces, but not
`sample()`-type counters, for example.

A wide variety of improvements to the thrift compiler wrapper

This is a partial rewrite of the compile context to support some future
planned features.  It also adds some basic unittests for this old and
new functioanlity.

- CompileContext.__init__(..., debug=False, ...).  Pass debug=True to
  persist any temporary files or directories.
- Use ctx.module_snapshot() to keep dynamically generated imports from
  polluting the global module cache
- Remove crazy dependency resolution, and crazy context manager bungling
  in favor of a more simple approach: compile the code with "-r" and without.
  The output dir generated with "-r" is added to the module path before
  generating the module.  The output dir generated without "-r" is used during
  the module generation traversal.
- CompileContext.makeTemporaryIncludeDir(): returns a NamedTemporaryDirectory
  containing symlinks to all explicit .thrift file and string dependencies.
- CompileContext.addIncludeDir(path): adds a -I `path` to thrift compiles.
- CompileContext.addDependentFilePath(path): if `path` is path/to/foo.thrift,
  symlinks to {tmpdir}/foo.thrift prior to compilation.
- CompileContext.addDependentFileContents(self, name, contents): saves
  `contents` to {tmpdir}/`name` prior to compilation.
- CompileContext.importThriftStr(contents): Let's you compile a raw string
  containing a thrift idl into a thrift module.

sparts.thrift.compiler: compile .thrift files on the fly

This change adds some new functionality to sparts: the ability to
compile .thrift files into python modules more directly.  This can be done
with the compile() function in `sparts.thrift.compiler`.   compile()
returns a dynamically-generated module object, which contains all of the
attributes of the ttypes.py and constants.py files, as well as all
declared thrift `service`s as attributes on the file.

For example, if foo.thrift contains `service FooService {...}`, a
thrift client can be generated totally on the fly in this way:

  from sparts.thrift import compiler, client

  foo = compiler.compile('foo.thrift')
  foo_client = client.ThriftClient(module=foo.FooService, ...)

It even supports inheritance (E.g., `service Foo extends FB303 {...}`),
Since dependent modules are generated and cached in a way that makes
them easier to import, this should make it easier to define your own
services that extend some common base functionality.

Expose access to options for third-party control

You may want to use the sparts library inside another system that
controls the argparse lifecycle. In this case, use
sparts.get_options(<service or task>) to get the option name(s) and
kwargs that can be used with argparse.ArgumentParser.add_argument().

One example is pytest. In order to expose your service's or task's cli
options as groups when running py.test cli you can use the
pytest_addoption plugin like so:

conftest.py:
```
from sparts import sparts, vtask

from my_service import MyService

def pytest_addoption(parser):
	group = parser.getgroup('MY-SERVICE-AND-TASKS')
	service_opts = sparts.get_options(MyService)
	for sopt in service_opts:
		group.addoption(*sopt.opt.opts, **sopt.opt.kwargs)
	for task in set(MyService.TASKS).union(vtask.get_registered_tasks()):
		task_opts = sparts.get_options(task)
		for topt in task_opts:
			group.addoption(*topt.opt.opts, **topt.opt.kwargs)
```

Make PeriodicTask test much faster

before each test was taking ~500ms.  Now, both combined take 120ms.

Do this by explicitly tracking threads and polling the counter after

of sleeping 500ms and *hoping* enough iterations had happened.

Faster QueueTask shutdown, better CPU usage

Currently, QueueTask polls the queue every 600ms, and checks for
shutdown events in-between.  This causes each queuetask-based test case
to take 600ms.

Instead of relying on the poll timeout, insert a sentinel object into
the queue on shutdown.  Check for the sentinel object, reinsert it, and
break if it's detected, so multi-worker queues can also shut down
gracefully.

As a result, I've decreased the polling interval from 600ms to 1.0s.  We
can probably increase this further, but will hold off for now unless
someone really needs this later on.

12ms per test case.

```
    def stop(self):
        """Stop the server.

        This method causes the serve() method to return.  stop() may be invoked
        from within your handler, or from another thread.

        After stop() is called, serve() will return but the server will still
        be listening on the socket.  serve() may then be called again to resume
        processing requests.  Alternatively, close() may be called after
        serve() returns to close the server socket and shutdown all worker
        threads.
        """
```

lambdas bind more loosely than partial function.  Fix this.

Bump version
Bump to 0.4.0,  Add changes from recent commits

Fail hard on unhandled exceptions.

After trying the alternatives:  (1) ignore-and-continue (e.g., for
PeriodicTask, QueueTask) or (2) die-and-continue (e.g., thread stops)

They both are less than ideal.  The default should be to kill the whole
program on exceptions.  This is the easiest way to encourage service
owners to fix broken services or tasks, and/or to be more resilient
of transient error scenarios.

Fixes #36

Significantly change vservice shutdown procedure

Currently VService.stop() is a blocking call.  It signals to the tasks
that they should stop, and then blocks, waiting for them to stop.

Let's change that for now.  There are three functions now:

.stop() - Signal that the service and tasks should stop
._wait() - Wait (polling) for the tasks to shutdown
.join() - (unused) Call join() on all the threads.

Fixes #37

Provide some hooks for graceful reactor shutdown

Provide some hooks to allow tasks that depend on twisted reactor task to
shutdown gracefully

@fmoo here's what I'm doing in my service:

read some messages off an aws sqs queue (up to 10 at a time) with a PeriodicTask (interval 0). Iterate through them and use a blocking put on my QueueTask's queue. That iteration of adding to the queue will only go as fast as the workers can pull stuff off. If the workers get backed up, I'll have up to 10 messages in memory but won't pick up anymore from sqs till I have capacity to process them. The real choke point is a downstream api call to a system that can get way bogged down.

Not sure if this should be lumped in here, or if it's worth looking into at all as a separate issue, but there isn't a way to pass flags to argparse at the moment. For example:

``` python
foo = option(
    name='foo',
    help='some option'
)
```

will produce the following help message:

```
optional arguments:
  --foo FOO        some option
```

but there isn't a way to have:

``` python
foo = option(
    flags=['-f', '--foo'],
    help='some option'
)
```

to produce:

```
optional arguments:
  -f, --foo FOO﻿﻿    some option
```

That being said, you can't have `-p, --pidfile` only `--pidfile` right now if that's important to you.

Unfortunately, qt's threading model just doesn't play nicely with sparts.

While glib/gtk is less python/user friendly, we've had much more success with it.

Tornado works with Py3.
There's also Py3 Thrift.
I can see an argument for dropping Twisted support.
Twisted is optional.  Also, if I recall correctly, twisted-13+ works with Python 3.3 and above.
@ryanrhee - does Apache thrift support Python 3 also?  Or is it just fbthrift?
oh it may just be fbthrift - not sure.
https://github.com/facebook/sparts/blob/master/sparts/sparts.py#L85 is causing the issue
So, there's no guarantee that the person who created the future is going to wait for the result, but I think this is the right tradeoff in behavior.

Last time I looked at this, getting flask run inside of sparts seemed to be impossible due to implementation specifics/limitations of the main flask engine.

There's also so many different ways of running flask (debug server, uwsgi, etc), that I'm not sure which would be best to support.

Another option might be to try to run sparts inside of flask instead of vice versa, but I'm not sure what that might look like.

Do you have any thoughts on what an ideal API would look like for integrating sparts with flask for you?

@@ -134,9 +143,21 @@ def initTask(self):
     def mainloop(self):
         return self.mainloop_task.mainloop
 
+    def asyncRun(self, cb, *args):
review_comments.body:
I'm thinking something like this might be cleaner / more easier to reuse:

``` python
def asyncRun(self, cb, *args, **kwargs):

    def _future_execute(f, cb, *args, **kwargs):
        try:
            # Only execute `cb` if the future wasn't cancelled
            if f.set_running_or_notify_cancel():
                f.set_result(cb(*args, **kwargs))
        except Exception as e:
            f.set_exception(e)

    def _future_cancel(f, handle):
        if f.cancelled():
            glib.source_remove(handle)

    f = Future()
    handle = glib.idle_add(partial(_future_execute, f, cb, *args, **kwargs))
    f.add_done_callback(partial(_future_cancel, f, handle))
    return f
```

This seems good because:
- The caller can choose to call `f.result()` on their own,  with or without a timeout as desired
- Callers don't have to implement future semantics in their callbacks or wrapping cb with the try:/except: blocks. 
- It support callers cancelling the idle-added function with native glib apis to remove the event source id as appropriate as well.
- It allows for **kwargs as well as *args since the wrapped callback passed to glib is a partial

Thoughts?
